result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert W Burghardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Probation may be transferred to Eau Claire County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Any other conditions deemed appropriate by the Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 90 DAYS - STRAIGHT TIME, commencing forthwith.
Apply 42 days sentence credit.
60 DAYS - NON WORKING HOURS (Huber) with all standard release conditions.  May be transferred to Eau Claire County but the Court does not authorize electronic monitoring.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Defendant Robert W Burghardt in court, in custody, with attorney Michael S. Holzman.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT;
  -  1 YEAR 6 M ONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S); (probation may be transferred to Eau Claire County).

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Any other term deemed appropriate by the agent.
*Perform 100 Hours of Community Service. 

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 150 Days.
90 DAYS - STRAIGHT TIME (APPLY 42 DAYS CREDIT);
60 DAYS - NON-WORKING HOURS (may be transferred to Eau Claire County but the Court does not authorize Electronic Monitoring).   

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
